page.title: 16KIRKCOWAN VILLAGE IN 1925
page.content: The{streets}were only dirt and stones and in Summer they became dusty and had to be sprayed by a water-cart.Some streets no longer exist and new houses have been built in other parts.There were more shops then.Shops which have disappeared include a{tailor's,}a{ {draper's,}a{blacksmith's,}a{milliner's and a{shoe maker's.}The ironmongers sold petrol less than{10p}a gallon but there were few cars.{P.C. Robertson} was the policeman and he patrolled behind the houses and if he found anyone stealing apples he gave them a skelp and sent them away.Trees were planted in the village to mark the victory at the battle of Waterloo in{ {1815.}The road up to where the{ {Poorhouse}stood was referred to as the Auld(old)Road.Tramps were given somewhere to sleep and something to eat and drink there.
